result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R. Algiers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of DNA Collection

10:01 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian R. Algiers in court.  Attorney Frank J. Parise in court for Brian R. Algiers. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter is resolved. Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders a $100 fine plus costs, DNA surcharge and Drug surcharge; 90 days to pay or 10 days KCJ or work crew.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court. Appeals rights given.

8:37 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian R. Algiers in court.  Attorney Frank J. Parise in court for Brian R. Algiers. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Parise is requesting an adjournment so he may provide the State with the information they have requested from the DE. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Frank Parise

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Frank Parise

Minutes:  1:58pm.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft placed under oath by the Court; questioned briefly about his financial status.  Court will approve the deft's request for advocate counsel.  Atty Frank Parise appointed.  Status set for 9/23/22 @ 8:30am.  Deft is ordered to pay $150/mo commencing 9/1/22.

records.addlTxt: DEF turned in PE for APPT of ATTY; placed paperwork in CRML CLRKs bin
ROTATION

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. DE appears late.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court cancelles authorization of bench warrant and does not forfeit bond. DE states he does not have an attorney yet but would like to hire one. STC set to 08/08/22 at 2:00.
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court forfeits bond and issues a $500 bench warrant.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Not Eligible for SPD Services - applicant is not eligible.  SPD has not secured representation

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

234PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.  $250  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
